source.a0e37751:
import numpy as np
import pandas as pd
from keras import layers, models
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

train = pd.read_csv("../input/tabular-playground-series-may-2021/train.csv")
test = pd.read_csv("../input/tabular-playground-series-may-2021/test.csv")
source.e7b9d74f:
train = train.drop('id',axis=1)
test = test.drop('id',axis=1)

X = train.drop('target',axis=1)
y = train['target']
y = pd.get_dummies(y)
source.df499d35:
model = models.Sequential()
model.add(layers.Dense(50, input_shape=X.shape, activation='relu', name="Hidden-1"))
model.add(layers.Dropout(0.25))
model.add(layers.Dense(25, activation='relu'))
model.add(layers.Dropout(0.25))
model.add(layers.Dense(10, activation='softmax'))
model.add(layers.Dropout(0.1))
model.add(layers.Dense(4, activation='softmax'))
model.compile(loss='categorical_crossentropy', optimizer='adam', metrics=['accuracy'])
model.summary()
source.78841d46: history = model.fit(X, y, epochs=30, batch_size=256, validation_split=0.3)
source.a17d4ecb:
plt.figure(figsize=(15,8))
plt.plot(history.history['loss'],lw=4)
plt.plot(history.history['val_loss'],lw=4)
plt.title('Model Loss',fontsize=20)
plt.ylabel('Loss',fontsize=15)
plt.xlabel('Epoch',fontsize=15)
plt.legend(['Train','Test'])
plt.show()

source.3b0f2901:
Tabular Playground Series - May 2021

![](https://storage.googleapis.com/kaggle-competitions/kaggle/25226/logos/header.png?t=2021-01-27-17-34-31) ## Data * train.csv - the training data, one product (id) per row, with the associated features (feature_*) and class label (target) * test.csv - the test data; you must predict the probability the id belongs to each class * sample_submission.csv - a sample submission file in the correct format
